sn6.9:1.2: His illness was caused by slandering Sāriputta and Moggallāna (SN 6.10, AN 10.89, Snp 3.10:3.3).| AN 10.89 combines this Sutta and the next.
sn6.9:3.3: The ancient Indian game of dice involved casting vibhītaka seeds (also known as “bedda nuts”, from Terminalia bellirica) in a hollow, from which the players would take a handful. A number divisible by four was “perfect” (kaṭa), so the fifth seed meant a “losing” hand (kali; cf. apaṇṇaka in MN 60 and notes).
sn6.9:5.1: The interpretation and calculation of these lines is explained at Snp 3.10:12.2.
